en: I took over my father's job.

en: I had my photograph taken by my father.

ko: 아빠한테 쿠미코가 중국에서 공부하는 게 좋겠다고 했어.

en: I can't talk with my father without losing my temper.
ko: 아빠랑 얘기하면 화를 안 낼 수가 없어.

en: I'm as tall as my father.

ko: 아빠랑 있을 때 마음이 편했던 적이 없어.

en: I don't see eye to eye with my father.

I know not only the father, but also the son.

ko: 우리 아빠 요리 잘하시는 게 정말 자랑스러워.

en: I'm not ashamed of my father's being poor.
I'm not ashamed of my father being poor.

ko: 아빠가 나를 키우신 것처럼 내 아들을 키우고 싶어.

en: I was given a computer game by my father.

en: I want my father to see the movie.

en: I usually get up at about six-thirty.
I usually get home by six o'clock.
I usually wake up at six.

en: I usually spend the whole day idly on Sunday.

en: I dreamed a strange dream.

ko: 불행은 늘 겹쳐서 온다는 걸 명심하고 있어요.

en: I'm all thumbs.
I, who am poor, cannot afford it.

en: I tanned myself on the beach.

en: I took care of my sick sister.

en: I had to decline the invitation because I was ill.

en: I had to decline the invitation because I was sick.

en: I was ill, otherwise I would have attended the meeting.

en: I work for a hospital.

en: I'm really unhappy about this.
I was very tired.
I was very exhausted.

I was able to catch the last train because I walked very quickly.
ko: 아주 빨리 걸어서 막차를 탈 수 있었어.

en: Since I walked very fast, I was in time for the last train.

en: I got up so early that I caught the train.

en: I was in such a hurry that I forgot to lock the door.

en: I do not feel sad.

I wasn't so much sad as I was angry.
